li.a: School Board/ Board Meeting Locations & Dates

div.h2: In Henry County, we envision all students experiencing success in a standards-based curriculum supported by professional staff, families, and communities.

td.a: Schools closed for remainder of academic school year
td.br: Governor Lee announced today that schools extend closure for the rest of the academic school year.
Update: PK and Kindergarten registration announce new call-in times

td.a: Henry County School System will reapply for LEAPs funding
td.br: This is a public notice that the Henry County School System will be applying for the Lottery for Education: Afterschool Programs grant for 2020. Currently, the system uses LEAP grant funding to offer free grades K-8 afterschool programs, Kid's Corner, at Harrelson, Henry, and Lakewood Schools.

td.a: District and School Teachers of the Year to be honored at March board meeting
td.br: On March 14 at Henry School during the monthly HCBOE meeting, our school and district teachers of the year will be recognized. District Teacher of the Year for grades PreK-4th is Ms. Pam Young, 4th grade teacher at Lakewood Elementary. Our district T.O.Y for grades 5-8 is Ms. Addy Byars, 8th grade ELA teacher at Lakewood Middle School. The 9th-12th grades District Teacher of the Year is Ms. Carol Carter, Health Sciences teacher at HCHS. School level teachers of the year are: Ms. Stacy Hudgins and Ms. Heather Kingery, Harrelson; Ms. Katie Hernandez and Ms. Patsy Barrow, Henry; and Mr. Ryan Inman, E.W. Grove. Congratulations to each of these outstanding educators in the Henry County School System.

td.a: Harrelson named School of Recognition by West TN Behavior Supports Project
td.br:
Harrelson School is one of twelve schools named as a 2018-2019 School of Recognition for their implementation of positive behavior support system, RTI-B(squared). Harrelson School is working in a consortium of schools with the West Tennessee Behavior Supports Project.
Response to Instruction and Intervention-Behavior (RTI²-B) is a Multi-Tiered System of Supports (MTSS) that offers a powerful, evidence-based approach for meeting the behavioral and social needs of students in Tennessee schools.
Harrelson School has made a shared school-wide commitment to teach and reinforce positive behavior. They have adopted an optimistic view that all students can learn appropriate behavior if sufficient and supportive opportunities to learn are provided. Harrelson school is creating a culture where all students and teachers are respected and included in their community.
The purpose of RTI²-B is to empower educators to equip all students with the opportunity to meet high expectations regarding behavior and the support to reach every student.
Congratulations Harrelson School!

td.a: TN Department of Education releases new state report card
td.br: The Tennessee Department of Education released a new state report card that includes a variety of new information about our district and our schools. You may seek information at the following link: https://reportcard.tnk12.gov/

td.a: Amber Ryan, assistant principal at Harrelson, named to Governor's Academy for School Leadership (GASL)
td.br: GASL is a statewide aspiring principals program tailored to prepare high-caliber assistant principals to become transformational leaders in schools across Tennessee. As a program fellow, Mrs. Ryan will have the opportunity to be trained in instructional leadership by some of the nation’s leading experts at Vanderbilt University, one of the nation’s top universities in educational leadership. Mr. David Kibbler, principal at Henry School, will serve as Mrs. Ryan's lead mentor during the program.

td.a: HCHS Cross Country Runners excel at State Tourney
td.br: HCHS freshman, Dinah Winders, finished 5th in the TSSAA Large School Girls Cross Country State Championship. Junior Silas Winders finished 14th and Senior Cole Davis earned the 16th spot and the boys team finished in 11th place during the TSSAA Large School Boys Cross Country State Championship. #hcsucceeds

td.a: Betsy Allison named NW CORE Supervisor of the Year
td.br: Mrs. Allison was honored as one of nine CORE supervisors of the year at a recent state banquet. We are grateful to have Mrs. Allison serving the students and teachers of HCSS.
